ygData.subject: Re: [neat] about number of genes
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I think genomes tend to get longer with age of the species. There are some reproduction errors that result in sequences getting repeated over and over -

Subject: Re: [neat] about number of genes

Hi,

I think genomes tend to get longer with age of the species. There are
some reproduction errors that result in sequences getting repeated
over and over - which result in the accumulation of 'junk' over time.
That said there is some evidence that some of the the 'junk' DNA in
the human genome does have a functional purpose - that is, although it
doesn't code for a protein it may have other roles roles, e.g.
interacting with protein synthesis to expand the range of proteins a
given gene sequence codes for.

Colin
